notes.text:
Migration Toolkit for Runtimes 1.1.0 release

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Migration Toolkit for Runtimes 1.1.0 ZIP artifacts

Security Fix(es):

* loader-utils: Regular expression denial of service (CVE-2022-37603)

* codec-haproxy: HAProxyMessageDecoder Stack Exhaustion DoS (CVE-2022-41881)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in loader-utils webpack library. When the url variable from interpolateName is set, the prototype can be polluted. This issue could lead to a regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS), affecting the availability of the affected component.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: loader-utils: Regular expression denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: loader-utils: Regular expression denial of service

notes.text: A flaw was found in codec-haproxy from the Netty project. This flaw allows an attacker to build a malformed crafted message and cause infinite recursion, causing stack exhaustion and leading to a denial of service (DoS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
